mods.note: Captain Peter D. Montgomery served in Company H, 6th Michigan Infantry during the Civil War. He was stationed first at Ft. McKim in Baltimore, then served in Louisiana. He was wounded at Port Hudson and resigned his commission in August 1864 as a result of his wounds. Letters to his cousin Ellen True of Chatauqua County, New York, relate his religious beliefs, health, weather, opinion of southerners, and family matters. He describes his part in the fighting at Port Hudson.
